content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Extraction System at (-3.5, 27.5)
Consists of the burner inserter placed at (-3.5, 27.5) with a drop position at (-3.5, 28.5). This component serves as the resource extraction point feeding resources into the multi‐segment belt network.

### Copper Cable Factory at (≈2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the following interconnected entities:
– Cable factory input chest at (2.5, 17.5)
– New factory burner inserter at (2.5, 16.5)
– Dedicated burner inserter placed at (3.5, 17.5) whose neighbors include an assembling machine at (1.5, 19.5)
This structure is designed to interface resource inputs with the copper cable production process.

### Belt Depot at (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Wooden chest serving as the belt depot at (3.5, 15.5)
– Adjacent transport belt segment at (4.5, 15.5)
– Depot burner inserter placed at (3.5, 14.5)
It functions as a consolidation and transfer point for resources coming from the extraction system via the transport belt network.

ERROR TIPS

– When connecting transport belts, the target must be a valid inserter rather than a steam engine object. Repeated errors indicate that attempting to connect directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine causes failed connections; always ensure an inserter is in place to receive items.

– Placement errors for entities such as the wooden chest have appeared. If placement fails because “the target position is too far away,” move the player closer to the intended tile before attempting placement.

– Ensure that required inventory items are available before placement. The “No wooden_chest in inventory” error shows a need to check inventory counts prior to executing placement commands.

– Undefined variable issues (e.g. “name 'target_chest' is not defined”) should be resolved by verifying that all object references are properly defined and that variable names match the intended targets before use.
